availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Benjamin Franklin Pullen (Bourbon County, Kentucky, sheriff)

body.p: Bourbon County, Kentucky, sheriff. Kentucky native. Married to Elizabeth F. Pullen. Father of Paulina W. Pullen, Elizabeth A. Pullen, and Minnie F. Pullen. Sheriff in Bourbon County, Kentucky, in 1858. Sheriff of Bourbon County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Bourbon County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Bourbon County, Paris, p. 485.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedule, Kentucky, Bourbon County, Paris, p. 140B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Bourbon County, Paris, Ward 1, p. 422A.
"Bourbon County--Official," The Louisville Daily Courier, August 05, 1858, p. 2.
"Death by Laudanum," The Courier-Journal, April 14, 1885, p. 4.
"Unfortunate Controversy in the Tenth Judicial District," The Louisville Daily Courier, April 25, 1868, p. 2.
"Benjamin Franklin Pullen (1825-1885)," Find A Grave, Memorial #159935757, accessed June 28, 2018, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/159935757.
